title: is it safe to say that BORK overtuned ADCS?
body:
https://i.gyazo.com/1ccce0b88647c9901e22f09971e0c228.png

kog jinx kalista cait varus jhin ezreal ashe lucian are picked/banned in lck

not only this but kennen is always picked top, and all those picks minus jhin rushes blade of the ruined king

so if they're banned over rengar, doesn't it mean that blade of the ruined king overtuned them?

Ruler is widely regarded as having a weak champion pool, so they tried to limit that by taking him off all of his comfort picks. Don't take anything out of context like this. It's ridiculous.

Bans in competitive play don't work quite like that.

But you're right it's true Ruined King is busted and must build first on every single auto attacker not named Jhin [whose using spells half the time]. It's first item on every other ADC and heck I've even seen a Graves build it 4th item. And he can't even continuously fire to maximize its on hit effect.

It's Riot's way of injecting the item right into the meta and relieving ADCs from their 2k17 meme status for a while.

But yeah pro play bans isn't just let's blanket ban all the OPs. It's targeted. Blue side has first pick and goes and bans 4 adcs and takes their choice going mwuhaha you must settle with 6th rank adc. Because ADC has a smaller list of relevant champs at any time compared to other roles. And even then playing short ranged Lucian into Ashe is not the funnest.

Valid strat regardless of the state of ADCs. But more prominent when they are stronger ofc.

Bork is overturned but you obviously don't understand how bans in competitive works rn. Like a few patches ago there were a few "OPs" that were picked/banned (Rengar, Lb, Camille, Varus - on red side, and possibly Maokai and Shen), all of which have been nerfed since.

Now it's based a lot on drafting - like if you want to first pick your ADC, you might ban out other ADCs (to pinch the champ pool) - which look, first pick Ashe for KT. Then they didn't pick ADC in first rotation of picks (picked support, JG , mid) - so they COULD attack top lane pool, BUT rumble and Camille are already banned and Kennen will crush any tank - so PINCH ADC pool even more - forcing Lucian against an ASHE giving Deft lane priority and stopping CoreJJ from roaming because of All In potential. Also huge dive potential because Karmas peel actually isn't that great and Lucian has no CC. Easy TP in from Kennen and just obliterate them under tower with Arrow + Wild growth + Ekko resetting tower aggro with ult. 

You should never look at competitive pick and bans that flatly - it's actually SUPER interesting if you look at how they work.
In that game, you see KT rolster take advantage of what they saw as a weak champion pool for Ruler, SSG's adc. Stop taking things out of context.

once again the boards aren't doing research. The reason for the bans in the screenshot are thus: Samsung failed to pick an adc in the first rotation, but they picked karma as a support. This allowed kt to target ban the botlane and pinch the ADC in a position where he didnt want to be in, and taking out champions that synergyse well with karma, so they banned out caitlyn and jhin, both laners who have an extremely oppressive early game with karma and both champs that are a headache when fed. This forced Samsung to pick lucian as their only hope of winning lane.

its almost like ADC is so overtuned now that you have to pick one of the boosted ones in your first rotation or you risk losing the game at the draft.

What adcs abusing an item balanced on melee? Who knew.

BotrK is a marksmen made item, riot stated that in the past that it's mainly meant for marksmen.
Sorry to burs your bubble.
marksmen made or not, it is balanced on melee and they arent the ones abusing it.

Thats like saying marksmen dont abuse rylies because it's not meant for them.
Just like some items are made specifically for a specific class, BotrK is made for marksmen and should be balanced around them

It's like talking to a wall. Botrk deals Current%HP dmg.

If you think you should be buying it every game, this is wrong.

The highest tier of pro-play isn't 'just every game'.

Botrk scales as an item, almost every person that buys it in pro play is thinking about late game, because if it wasn't pro-play, they would win before late game exists. Not only are they considering the fact that they're scaling out the whole game, but when they buy it Baron normally crosses their mind too.

Combine it's actual mechanics of bleeding off the high poke HP and it's easy to see why it's favored, you just auto 3 times and then use your abilites to nuke their remaining HP and that's enough to kill someone on almost any ADC. Then you also get a crazy slow-speed stealer that is more effective and useful now that ghostblade is better and being spammed and the re-rise of mobility creep.

But if you think this is a cure-all replacement and is better than a 3/0 IE start, nope no way.
How do you make BoRK equally good on melees and ADCs? It may be overtuned for ADCs now but isn't really for melees.
It turned Lucian from one of the worst adc's to 50% play rate and 50%+ wr. Combined with his own buffs but he abuses it the most. Then you've got every other adc rushing it.

Actually it wasnt just Bork, but also Black Cleaver changes that helped him.

As you mentioned he was buffed at one point (to make him less of a troll pick), and those buffs combined with those two item changes came together to make him what he is now.
its a little OP yeah. but I hope they don't totally gut it, because it actually makes for a pretty fun adc meta

I think this is just the adc meta cycle. It goes something like, bortk, crit, leathality, back to bork and so on. If any of these become slightly better than the other then the whole adc tier system is flipped on its head and champions who best abuse the meta items are the ones on top.

I don't think there is a way to balance it to be perfectly honest. There will always be a really bad choice and a really good choice for adc, and no amount of balancing will find a happy medium
